name: GAD-7 Anxiety Assessment
description: 7-item self-report questionnaire to screen for and assess severity of generalized anxiety disorder

questions.label: Feeling Nervous or Anxious
questions.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge?

questions.label: Uncontrollable Worrying
questions.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by not being able to stop or control worrying?

questions.label: Excessive Worrying
questions.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by worrying too much about different things?

questions.label: Trouble Relaxing
questions.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by trouble relaxing?

questions.label: Restlessness
questions.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by being so restless that it's hard to sit still?

questions.label: Irritability
questions.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by becoming easily annoyed or irritable?

questions.label: Anticipatory Anxiety
questions.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by feeling afraid as if something awful might happen?

riskCategories.name: Minimal Anxiety
riskCategories.description: Minimal anxiety symptoms - No clinically significant anxiety disorder

riskCategories.name: Mild Anxiety
riskCategories.description: Mild anxiety symptoms - May indicate mild GAD or adjustment disorder

riskCategories.name: Moderate Anxiety
riskCategories.description: Moderate anxiety symptoms - Likely indicates GAD or other anxiety disorder

riskCategories.name: Severe Anxiety
riskCategories.description: Severe anxiety symptoms - Strong indication of GAD requiring immediate attention

references.title: Spitzer RL, et al. A brief measure for assessing generalized anxiety disorder: the GAD-7
Löwe B, et al. Validation and standardization of the Generalized Anxiety Disorder Screener (GAD-7) in the general population
Johnson SU, et al. Psychometric properties of the General Anxiety Disorder 7-item (GAD-7) scale in a heterogeneous psychiatric sample

metadata.targetPopulation: Adults (18+ years) in primary care and mental health settings
metadata.clinicalUse: Screening and severity assessment for generalized anxiety disorder; monitoring treatment response
metadata.disclaimer: This tool is for screening and educational purposes. A score ≥10 suggests probable GAD and warrants further clinical evaluation. Not a substitute for professional clinical assessment.
